content.raw:
I recently upgraded to a newer version of ign and my solution broke.  The first issue appears to be that the “image\_raw” topics have compression applied before being uncompressed and published.  This breaks my image recognition system.  Are they being compressed anywhere before being published?

I have attached two images.  The first image shows the levels \(using gimp\) of what an uncompressed image should look like.  The histogram of the levels is smooth.  The second image \(uncompressed\_broken\) shows significant level banding in the levels histogram.  It appears it was compressed along the line before being uncompressed and published.
content.html:
I recently upgraded to a newer version of ign and my solution broke. The first issue appears to be that the “image_raw” topics have compression applied before being uncompressed and published. This breaks my image recognition system. Are they being compressed anywhere before being published?

I have attached two images. The first image shows the levels (using gimp) of what an uncompressed image should look like. The histogram of the levels is smooth. The second image (uncompressed_broken) shows significant level banding in the levels histogram. It appears it was compressed along the line before being uncompressed and published.
